OB/GYNs
Ob/GYNs are specialists in the care of pregnant women. Their work is extremely satisfying however it can be stressful as births are complicated and sometimes things go wrong. It’s therefore important that OB/GYNs are up-to-date with the latest medical research and are prepared to deal with various situations.
In addition to extensive training requirements, OB-GYNs are required to undergo a residency prior to when they are able to practice. The education they receive during their residency is essential, and if an OB-GYN commits a mistake during the course of his or their duties that causes an injury to a baby the doctor could be held responsible for malpractice.
A birth injury claim may be based on any type of negligence that was committed during the process of birth by healthcare professionals, including inability to provide the standard of care that a reasonable health professional would have provided under similar circumstances. An Atlanta birth injury lawyer can review the circumstances of the birth injury law firm to determine if medical malpractice occurred and, if it did, who was responsible.
Birth injuries that are serious can have a lasting impact on a child’s quality of life. They can impact the ability of a child to move or speak, learn, and function and that’s why it’s so important to ensure that healthcare professionals are held accountable when they commit errors during the birth process. Our Atlanta birth injury lawyers are able to consult medical experts to give testimony to support your case.
Depending on the extent of the birth injury your child sustained depending on the severity of the birth injury, you could be entitled to compensation for the loss of earning potential, medical bills as well as pain and suffering and more. Our Atlanta birth injury attorneys will help you pursue every penny you’re entitled to.
Georgia law defines the time limit for filing an action in court. There are a few exceptions to Georgia’s statute of limitations. For example the discovery rule which extends the deadline depending on when you first knew or should have realized that your child was injured during birth. The sooner you hire an Atlanta birth injury lawyer the more likely it is that you’ll get the compensation you deserve.
Hospitals
During pregnancy, labor, and delivery, a variety of things can be a disaster. These situations can result in birth injuries if they are caused by medical negligence. This can alter the life of a family forever. A claim can include both economic and other damages according to the extent of the injury. Economic damages include hospital bills, prescriptions and therapy costs and lost wages. Non-economic damages include the emotional, physical, and mental pain that the family has to endure as a result of the birth injury.
Despite the best injury lawyers , visit the following web site , efforts of doctors, nurses, and other medical personnel it is still possible that a patient will be the victim of a preventable birth injury. This is the reason hospitals must adhere to certain standards of care. When a doctor fails to adhere to the standard of care, it’s considered medical malpractice.
For example doctors might not react quickly enough when the baby’s heart rate decreases or use the incorrect medication. They may also make a mistake when using a forceps or vacuum to deliver the baby, or they might use too much force when doing so. A birth injury lawsuit could be filed in the event that any of these errors cause permanent harm.
A majority of these claims are filed against the liable healthcare provider’s insurance company. It is crucial to find an attorney with experience working with insurance companies. They can assist you in negotiating an agreement that will cover all your damages.
Premature births babies born before 37 weeks are more likely to suffer serious birth injuries due to their infancy muscles, brains, and organs. Atlanta’s premature delivery rate is the most high of any city in the United States, earning it an “F” from March of Dimes.
Cerebral palsy – This category of disorders is characterized by a variety of symptoms that affect motor skills and coordination. It is caused by oxygen deprivation during birth. This could result from the doctor not performing the C section, or using too much force during the delivery or not being able to detect the mother’s signs of distress.
Manufacturers of Equipment
A birth injury can occur when the medical device fails to work properly or if the equipment at a hospital fails during a delivery. A lawsuit can be filed against the manufacturer to seek damages for your child and you, whether the cause is due to manufacturing issues or a defect with the device. Our Atlanta birth injury attorneys understand how to assess these instances and determine the best approach.
When it comes to filing an action for medical malpractice, it is important to choose an attorney who understands not only the specific medical issue but who also knows Georgia law, as well as the local courts and juries. In a case of birth injury, there are several parties that can be held responsible including doctors and nurses hospitals, equipment, and manufacturers. Our birth injury lawyers will review every aspect of the case to determine all parties liable.
Medical malpractice claims can be filed against any healthcare provider that did not meet their obligation of care to the patient, which led to the death or injury of a patient. This includes doctors nurses, obstetricians and nurses midwives, pediatricians and gynecologists, and hospitals. Our Atlanta birth injury lawyers will review your case and determine who is responsible for the injuries your child suffered. They will then assist you receive the compensation that you deserve.
Oxygen deprivation in labor and delivery is among the most common birth injuries. This can result in brain damage and cerebral paralysis. It is vital that your doctor responds quickly to signs of fetal stress.
Medical malpractice can also occur when your doctor does not communicate effectively with your team during the delivery process and something “falls through the cracks.”
The value of your claim consists of several different elements, including economic and non-economic damages. Economic damages can include the past, future, and current medical expenses, prescriptions, therapy and lost wages if you were unable work due to the injuries suffered by your child and other economic losses. Non-economic damages include your child’s pain and suffering and loss of enjoyment of life, mental distress, and other intangible losses. Our Atlanta birth injury lawyers are able to calculate your damages and will work tirelessly against the insurance company to ensure you are compensated fairly. In some cases, punitive damages or exemplary damages can be awarded if the acts of the party responsible were blatantly negligent or reckless or malicious, whether intentionally or not.

A doctor, nurse or other medical professional making mistakes can result in severe injuries to a baby, which could impact their health and growth for the rest of their lives. The injured child may require long-term care, which could result in significant financial costs for the family. A legal action against a negligent healthcare professional demands the proof of a number of elements. First, the medical professional must be bound by a duty of care to the mother and child during pregnancy, labor, and delivery. This means that they must adhere to national guidelines and guidelines. The next element is causation, which means that the violation of the doctor’s duty directly led to the birth injury. This is typically proven by expert testimony.
Damages are a third factor. The plaintiff must have suffered compensable damages as a result, like loss of income, continued medical treatment, therapy, or emotional trauma. Punitive or exemplary damages can be awarded in situations when the healthcare professional responsible for the injury’s conduct is particularly shocking or outrageous.
